title: Suggestion to use import to unstable feature on stable

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
trait DefaultResultOk<T: Default, E> {
    fn Ok() -> Result<T, E> {
        Ok(default())
    }
}

impl<T: Default, E> DefaultResultOk<T, E> for Result<T, E> {
    
}
```

I expected to see this happen: 

```
error[E0425]: cannot find function `default` in this scope
 --> src/lib.rs:3:12
  |
3 |         Ok(default())
  |            ^^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |
help: consider importing one of these items
  |
1 | use std::default::Default::default;
  |
```

Instead, this happened:

```
error[E0425]: cannot find function `default` in this scope
 --> src/lib.rs:3:12
  |
3 |         Ok(default())
  |            ^^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |
help: consider importing one of these items
  |
1 | use core::default::default;
  |
1 | use pin_utils::core_reexport::default::default;
  |
1 | use std::default::default;
  |
```

If I select the third option and compile again I get the following error:

```
error[E0658]: use of unstable library feature 'default_free_fn'
 --> src/lib.rs:1:5
  |
1 | use std::default::default;
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #73014 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73014> for more information
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
1.53.0
```

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=3345aaf81ba391e16679c6af042c537f
